Issue.creator: rickr
Issue.description: Currently user context is set on the client and later requests are created and sent on the client. This means the client may not switch user context between that time or the request would be done on that user. To be thread safe the client would need to be dedicated to just one Java thread. This is too heavyweight. By allowing users to set the user context on the requests themselves there is no need to switch at the client level but can fall back to that if not explicitly set on the request.
